decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank wall(s) of the building(s) hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.
In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.
In the interests of the amenity of the occupiers of neighbouring dwelling.

This prior approval consent does not remove the need to obtain any separate consent in respect to covenants on the land prior to commencing building works. This is a matter within separate legislation in law and the Local Planning Authority is not involved in such matters.
description: Single storey rear extension with an overall depth of 4.00m, a maximum height of 3.32m, and an eaves height of 3.00m. (PRIOR APPROVAL)
